revised_title: The Existence of Multiple Fungi in Madura Disease: A Comparative Study of the Melanoid and White Varieties
tldr: The authors investigate the existence of more than one fungus in Madura disease (mycetoma) and provide a comparative study of the melanoid and white varieties. They demonstrate the presence of a highly organized fungus and a delicate, lowly organized type, similar to Actinomyces, in the disease. The authors also discuss the methods used to identify and examine the fungi in the tissue samples.
